For four years, she has been selling fish in “Bernard Farm Market” on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of fish. 

She describes herself as a determined woman whose dream is to improve her business and continue her education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Susan Koinato

texts.en:
Susan is 23 years old, a single mother of one school-going child.  She has been in livestock farming for the last three years.  

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy six calves which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

Susan hopes to build her own house in future, enabling her to move out of her parents' house where she currently lives with her child.

loans.use: To buy 6 calves which she will sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Nemu-Nyaeh Group

texts.en:
Irene J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Nemu-nyaeh'.  She is 37 years old, married, and has four children whose ages are between four and fifteen years. She was only able to attend school through ninth grade due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling.

For thirteen years, she has been selling charcoal on Rehab Road, Paynesville on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 26,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She describes herself as a God-fearing woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Roseline Njeri

texts.en:
Roseline, 33 years old, has been in the real estate business for three year now.  She finds the business profitable and now wants to grow and diversify by opening up a green grocery shop.  

As she was looking for capital, a friend recommended KADET to her and that’s how she came to approach us. 

Roseline hopes to renovate her rental houses and improve them by using more durable materials in future. This will make them longer-lasting and help her save on unnecessary expenses such as repairs.  Her rent income will also increase.

loans.use: To use as capital to open up a green grocery shop

loans.name: Habel Kamau

texts.en:
Habel is 30 years old, married to Ann Wangu, and they have one child.  He has been transporting people and goods from one place to another using his bicycle.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 15,000 well and on time.  He plans to use proceeds from this loan to buy another bicycle which is enhanced with an engine.  He will employ someone else to help him in the business.

loans.use: To buy another bicycle enhanced with an engine

loans.name: Nahashon Njoroge

texts.en:
Nahashon is 26 years old and he has been transporting people and goods from one place to the other using his bicycle in Naivasha town for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 18,500 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy another bicycle which is enhanced with an engine.  He will employ someone else to operate it for him.

Nahashon hopes to grow in the transportation business by owning his own fleet of mini-buses.

loans.use: To buy another bicycle enhanced with an engine

loans.name: Golarmah Group

texts.en:
Alfred G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Golarmah'.  He is 40 years old, married, and has two children, two and fourteen years old.  He is a college drop-out due to lack of financial support. 

For five years, he has been involved in a transportation business using a motorcycle in the Pipeline road community in Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more spare parts and petroleum for his motorcycle. He describes himself as a friendly man whose dream is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and petroleum for his motorcycle

loans.name: Mayyada

texts.en:
Mayyada S. is a young woman from Deir Al Balah in the Gaza Strip. Mayyada has an eight-month-old daughter named Mayyar. Mayyada's husband, Muhammad, is a National Palestinian Authority employee. Mayyada and Muhammad run a clothing store in the city. The store is located in a housing area, which ensures a good number of customers.

Mayyada helps her husband run the store in the morning while he is at work.  The store helps the family financially as PNA salaries are usually low. Mayyada has come to FATEN to take a $1500 loan to purchase winter clothes to prepare for the coming season.

Mayyada's husband appears in the above picture, standing in the small store where they sell clothes and make-up, as Mayyada is not comfortable with having her picture published online.

loans.use: Purchase new clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more medicine for his business

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen T. N. is 50 years old with two children who are attending high school. She has  opened a shop that sells many kinds of cakes and noodles; she has been in this business for 5 years. Her business is good. She earns 100,000 VND profit per day. Joining our credit program in 2004, she has used  loans very  effectively in expanding her  shop. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy rice as a raw material to make cakes.

loans.use: to buy rice as a raw material to make cakes

loans.name: Group Of Unity

texts.en:
Laurance C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Group Of Unity'.  He is 26 years old, single, and has two children, four and six years old. He was only able to attend school through twelfth grade due to lack of financial support. 

For nine years, he has been selling door locks, hinges, nails, zinc, hammers, etc. in Red light Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more door locks, hinges, nails, zinc, hammers, etc.
 
He describes himself as a hard-working man whose dream is to improve his business and continue his education.

loans.use: To buy more door locks, hinges, nails, zinc, hammers, etc

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet T. T. is 53 years old with two children who are at  university. She is running a shop that sells pure water.  She does not only sell retail but also wholesale . That is the reason why she can earn 4,000,000 profit per month. Since she received her first loan in 2004, she has used the proceeds of her loans to invest in her shop effectively. Currently, she wants to borrow  7,630,000 VND to buy  more cans of pure water to meet the increasing demand in  summer.

loans.use: to buy  more cans of pure water to meet the increasing demand in  summer

loans.name: Serik

texts.en:
Serik H. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a 'ger', the traditional nomadic housing tent. His son currently attends a local secondary school, and his two daughters, ages 4 and an infant, stay at home with his wife. 

Serik operates a taxi service in his town. He started her business in 2007 after moving to the city from the countryside. He sold his livestock and bought a new car which is used as his taxi today. His earnings are the only form of income for his family. Serik is a very generous and hardworking person. For the future, the family is very focused on growing his business. He hopes to build his own house with a yard. Serik is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to keep his car in good repair.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin A. J. is a student and an ambitious young woman from Gaza city in Gaza Strip. Yasmin's husband, Muhammad, pictured above, started a small grocery store in the city four years ago. It is the only source of income for the family. Yasmin is also paying her tuition fees from the store profits.

Muhammad needs the $1500 loan to purchase food and other items to be sold in the store. (Because of her religious background, Yasmin does not wish to have her photo published.)

loans.use: Purchase grocery store supplies

loans.name: Kalimat

texts.en:
Kalimat B. is 51 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. The family moved to the central town of Bayan Ulgiy province in 2004 because of their children's education. They used to live in the countryside in the nomadic lifestyle. Their oldest son serves in a military force on the border of the country. Their two younger sons attend university while their youngest, a daughter, stays at home with her mother. 

Kalimat began his taxi service business in 1998 and has gained a lot of business experience. He transports local residents to and from various points in his province. He uses his business earnings to pay his children's tuition fees. Because of his cheerful and gentlemanly character, he gains a lot of permanent customers. He says, " I want to provide a good education for my children and build a big house for them, too." 

Kalimat is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to prepare for wintertime as well as to pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay his children's tuition fees

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg O. is 41 years old, a married woman with three daughters. She lives with her family in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her older two daughters, 20 and 18, are students and they live and study in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her younger daughter, 16, attends a local high school, while her husband is currently unemployed. 

Altantsetseg operates a traveling goods-selling business in her town. She usually purchases her products from wholesale stores at the town market and sells those products in the local community for a profit. Over the many years of operation, she has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. She is a hard-working, modest woman who  would like to keep growing her business. Her goals are to provide for her daughters' education and to have her own workplace in the future. 

Altantsetseg needs more money to pay her daughters' tuition as well as their rent, therefore she is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To pay her daughters' tuition fees

loans.name: Byambadolgor

texts.en:
Byambadolgor T. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two children both currently attend university in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. 

Byambadolgor operates a grocery and consumer goods trading business in the street with help of her husband. She began her own business in 2000 and has been selling a variety of products in the street since 2004. One or two times a month, she buys her inventory both from wholesale stores locally and in Ulaanbaatar. She is a very accurate and tough minded person. 

Byambadolgor would like to one day own her own grocery store where she can sell a larger variety of goods that will attract many more customers. And also she wants to provide her children a good education. She is requesting a 3,700,000 Mongolian tugrug loan so that he can purchase a larger variety of grocery products at wholesale price from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of grocery products

loans.name: Ngalla

texts.en:
Ngalla M. B. is a married man with four children between nine years and one year old. His business is located at Shibu Tumaini in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites--not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

He has been selling shoes to the local people for the last four years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is insufficient funds. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more shoes to expand his business and sell at wholesale to other retailers. 

He also hopes to diversify his business so that when shoes sales are low, he still can continue with his business profitably. He describes himself as patient, determined and open minded.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor S. is a 30-year-old widow who lives with her two grandchildren in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. 

Dolgor operates a retail cosmetic business in a rented outdoor stall at a local market. She began her business in 2007 and has grown steadily over the years due to her loyal customers. Twice a month, Dolgor purchases a variety of beauty products from Mongolia s capital city, Ulaanbaatar, restocking her business depending on her sales. Her children send her some Japanese cosmetic products from Japan where they currently live and work. 

Dolgor is a polite and responsible person. She says, "My children are abroad, and I work for my grandchildren to provide them a good education." She is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more beauty products at wholesale prices from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products

loans.name: Munhsuren

texts.en:
Munhsuren D. is 53 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 25 and 20, in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her youngest son attends university while her husband works as a driver for a company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Munhsuren has a fabric store, selling a variety of materials by the meter. She began her private business by operating a retail clothing business in a rented stall at Anduud, one of the big trade centers in Ulaanbaatar. After that, she started to sell second-hand fabrics in a local market of her town. 

Munhsuren has been running her current business since 2007. Depending on her sales, she purchases her inventory products 1-3 times a month. She is a very hard-working woman. She hopes to continue her business with sustainable operations and to have her own big shop. Munhsuren is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of fabric at a wholesale price from Ulaanbaatar for her business.

loans.use: purchasing fabric in bulk at wholesale

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Ulugbek M. is a very open-hearted seller of children's toys. He is 43 years old and has two school-aged children.  Ulugbek started his business in 1998 and achieved success due to his strong efforts and persistent personality. Ulugbek s small shop was known among his little loyal customers as  a place of joy, where they can find different kinds of playthings. 

Unfortunately, in June 2010, Ulugbek lost his business, which was robbed and looted during violent clashes caused by a deposed political regime. But Ulugbek, being very optimistic and hard-working person, didn t give up and did his best to rise from the ruins.  

Ulugbek is applying for a loan of 135,000 Kyryzstani Soms to resume his lost business and continue his activities. He plans to buy a parcel of soft toys for reselling now and playthings for the future New Year s celebrations. It will allow him further development of his shop and to invite his little smiling customers back. 

Ulugbek believes that citizens of Osh will certainly celebrate all festivals and holidays together like one family, in friendship and solidarity.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase toys for reselling

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, a 32-year-old married mother of one, is a hardworking lady who works as a tailor to earn a living.  In the business for three years now, she has developed a good client base, and she also farms to supplement her family’s income.  Virginia is grateful to belong to the Ikinu Clean Shine Group in Faulu Kenya because membership has enabled her to save money.  She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 kes in order to purchase another sewing machine and additional fabric, and hopes for continued and growing success in her business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna, a 34-year-old mother of four children between 12 and 4 years old, is married to Josemaria and lives with her family in Katito town, which is on the outskirs of Kisumu city.

Lorna has been a tailor for the last 14 years, and the business is doing well because she has created a huge clientelle. Lorna is applying for her first loan after seeing how her friend, a client of KADET LTD, benefited from the loan she received. She plans to use the money for the purchase of materials to add to her stock to meet the demands of her clients. Now earning a monthly income of Kshs 12,000, Lorna hopes to use the additional profits made to buy a sewing machine and employ one person to help her run her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to see her business expand and grow and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Joseph S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you teachers of the R.C. Primary School, Kathanthabana village, eight miles from Makeni. R.C. Primary School was founded in 1964 by the R.C. Mission. R.C. Primary school is staffed with ten teachers and  has185 pupils. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Joseph S. K. (pictured here) is the head teacher and leader of this group. The 52-year-old Joseph was born in Binkolo village, about six miles from Makeni. He has been in the teaching profession for sixteen years now. He is married to a teacher and the couple has seven children – two in primary school and five in secondary school. 

Mr. K. backs up his teaching income with agriculture. He has been an agriculturist for seven years now.  He will use part of his loan to pay school fees for his children and invest the rest in agriculture. He plants groundnuts and palm-trees.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children and invest the rest in agriculture

loans.name: Joshua Odhiambo

texts.en:
Joshua O. O. is 34 years of age. He is married to Caroline Ouma and is a father of two children, aged 12 and 10. He supports a family of two children. He owns a garage as his primary business and also supplies foodstuffs as a secondary business that is largely run by his wife. Both businesses give them an average profit of 12000 Kenyan shillings (kshs).

He has borrowed a loan of kshs 60,000, of which he intends use kshs 40,000 to purchase spare parts, kshs 16,000 to purchase food supplies (rice) and Kshs 4,000 to pay rent. 

This being his sixth loan, Joshua is optimistic that it will help his business in that he will be able to get more stock for his garage. Joshua's hopes and dreams are to open a spare-parts wholesale shop and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina C. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling kitchenware. She lives in Mojon, Tutay, Pinamungajan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her kitchenware business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Lina is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 26,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: New kitchenware stock to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 53 years old and is a widow with four children aged between 10 and 24 years old. They live in a rural area in Usenge, which is in the outskirts of Kisumu city.

Florence does some retail business that majorly deals with the selling of school uniforms. She has been in this business for the last four years and has thus created a huge clientele with the nearby schools. She is applying for her second loan after successfully completing the first one.

Her hopes and dreams are to one day have a big shop for supplying uniforms as well as to open up a tailoring school to train people in the tailoring of the school uniforms.

loans.use: Buy more school uniforms to add to her stock

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. is a married woman who lives in Tutay, Pinamungajan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  hog raising and  kitchenware businesses. Her husband, Fabiano M., who is 48 years old, works as a kitchenware salesman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's other business activities.  They have six children who are 11  to  23 years old. Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her hog raising and kitchenware businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future for family and education. Teresita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Working capital for her hog raising and kitchenware businesses

loans.name: Brima

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Brima.  He is married, and has one child aged six. He has nine additional dependents.   In the year 2000, Brima established his Provisions business selling milk, sugar, butter, tea, sardines, etc. He began his business because he wanted to improve the standard of living of himself and his family. 

Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000SLL every month from this business. He needs a loan of 4,000,000SLL. Brima requires a loan to be able to buy his goods in bulk so that his can make more profit. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000SSL. 

In the future, Brima plans to educate his child to university level and buy a piece of land, rent a shop, hire a salesperson, and sell his goods wholesale. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for his provisions shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for her stall

loans.name: Josette

texts.en:
Josette A. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   furniture-making, farming, and hog raising businesses. She lives in Tuod, Brgy.Isio, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

 By working hard in her   three  businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 20,000 PHP. Josette is now borrowing  15,000 PHP so that she  can purchase  materials for her furniture-making business.  This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Josette aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for her furniture-making business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ejartu

texts.en: Ejartu is married and has one child who is 15 years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her because she wants to help educate them.  In 1993, Ejartu established her used clothing business. She began her business to help her husband support their family.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 1,425,700 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Ejartu requires a loan in order to add stock to her business.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. She intends to use the proceeds from this to educate her children to the university level.  In the future, Ejartu plans to rent a shop and travel to her neighboring country in order to buy large quantities of used clothing.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Benny A. is a married woman with two children who are 13 and 14 years old. Her husband, Joefran, is 44 years old and works as a tricycle driver. The family lives in Purok Rubia, a part of Barangay Binobohan, Bago City in the Negros Occidental province on the Western Visayas islands. Benny has three businesses: sugarcane farming, buying and selling dry goods, and raising and selling pigs. Joefran also helps his wife with her businesses.

Benny joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past fifteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Benny has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 17,000 PHP, lifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her sixteenth loan cycle, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more fertilizer for her sugarcane farm. She intends to use the profits to continue saving up for the future education of her children and the expansion of her businesses. Benny A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her sugarcane farm

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta C. (pictured at her vegetable vending business) is a married woman who has seven children between the ages of 12 to 32 years old. Her husband, Romeo, is 60 years old and a farmer. The family lives in Purok Paraiso within Barangay Taloc, Bago City, in the province of Negros Occidental on the Western Visayas islands. Marietta has three businesses: selling vegetables, running a general store and farming. Romeo also helps in his wife's business activities.

Marietta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marietta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 15,000 PHP, so lifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her sixth loan cycle, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy fertilizer for her farm and buy some pigs to raise so that she can continue to save up to educate her children and lift their living conditions. Marietta C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis M. M. is thirty-seven years old, married and has three children aged between one and half and seven years old. His business is located in Bombolulu, a residential area in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attractions, including the Indian Ocean’s white sand beaches.

Francis has been selling mobile accessories for the last five years to local people. He says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge he faces is that in his area there are so many people doing the same kind of business as he is. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He describes himself as customer-friendly.

Francis is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more phone accessories to expand his business. He hopes to grow and be able to improve his family's living standards. He also hopes to give his children a quality education and own a house some day.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories

texts.en:
Ninda E. is a 62-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a general store and an RTW business. She lives in Prk.Paraiso, Brgy. Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and RTW businesses, Ninda is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,500 PHP. Ninda is now borrowing 19,500 PHP to purchase more stock to sell in her General Store. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ninda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma S. is a married woman who has nine children between the ages of 14 and 34 years old. Seven already have their own families, while two are living at home and currently going to school. Her husband, Romeo S., is 57 years old and works as a fish vendor. The family lives in Purok Nipa within Barangay Mahawak, Medellin municipality in the province of Cebu on the Visayas islands. Norma also sells dried fish and fattens pigs for market.

Norma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past twelve loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Norma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 16,000 PHP and lift the family's standard of living. This time, for her thirteenth loan cycle, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more dried fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Norma S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena M. is a 61-year-old woman who supports her family through three business ventures: food vending, rice and fish vending and coco wine production. She lives in Purok 6 within Barangay Linao, a part of Kabankalan City in the province of Negros Occidental on the Visayas islands. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard selling food, rice and fish and producing coco wine, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12500 PHP. She earns this amount because of her hard work and her business acumen; at harvest time, she exchanges cooked food for raw rice from farmers.

Azucena is now borrowing 20000 PHP so that she can expand her food vending activities. This will be her fifteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 17500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Azucena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Bedzame

texts.en:
Bedzame M. Mwavuo is a married man. His wife is a farmer and they have three children aged between twelve years and two years old.

Bedzame’s business is located at the busy Mwembe Tayari market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean’s white beaches.

Bedzame has been selling secondhand clothes for the last four years to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is insufficient capital. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

Bedzame is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more secondhand clothes to expand his business. He hopes to obtain his own premises in which to do business where he will not be paying rent.

Bedzame hopes to give his children a quality education. He describes himself as forward thinking and business-minded.

loans.name: Yusifu S.

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Yusifu, who is married and has two children aged 7 and 10 years. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because Yusifu wants to educate her.

In 2000, Yusifu started his business in ready-made items such as shoes, bags and clothes. He began his business when he was financed by his elder brother, to enable him to cater for his family. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about 733,700 SLL every month from his business.

Yusifu would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 600,000 SLL.

In the future, Yusifu plans to start saving to educate his child to university level, to rent a shop and to supply colleagues in business. He thanks you for your support.

She lives in Purok Demokrasya, Brgy Fabrica, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her battery-repair and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Eva is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase raw materials for her battery repair/rehabilitation business. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Eva aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and insure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn A. is a married woman who lives in Purok Pine Tree, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: food vending, fishing and a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Julito Mojillo, who is 41 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have seven children who range in age from 7 months to 22 years old. Four of the children already work to help her support their family and one is still going to school. Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000, which she intends to use as revolving working capital for her food-vending business so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family and for the education of her child who is still going to school. Marilyn A. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional working capital for business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cartons of  fish for his business .

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane L. is a 37-year old married woman who supports her family by fishing and fish vending. She lives in Purok Cogon III, Brgy Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She currently earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. 

Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can increase the volume of fish she is selling.  This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mary Jane aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to obtain more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various supplies for her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing for his stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more foodstuff for resale

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: cette dame est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé.elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sachets en plastiques, elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce. elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante, sa clientèle est composée de toutes personnes. son stock est en baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour acheter 50 balles de sachets.
texts.en:
This lady, a married mother of two children, lives with her family in a neighborhood of Adidogomé which is a suburb of Lomé. She generates income through a plastic bag business which she has been doing for three years. She conducts business on foot and her clients consist of all types of people. Her stock is depleted and she wants to replenish it, so she is asking for a second loan through WAGES to buy 50 bales of bags.

Translated from French by Katherine Evans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic bags

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married and has two teenage sons. He lives in the town of Kamenka, where he makes a living selling office supplies, books, text books, plastic bags and other retail items. Over the years, he has established good connections with local schools and other organizations which help him keep his sales pretty high all year long. Gennadyi has been in this business for 10 years, and currently has an inventory worth 40,000 Grivnyas. His net profit comes to about 3,000-5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Gennadyi has used micro loans before and found them a great way to increase the success of his business. He is applying for a loan of 18,046 Grivnyas to buy additional merchandise that students will need during the school year that just started. He is hoping to generate extra income this season so that he can continue to grow his small business. He has an impeccable credit record and is confident that he can repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: dovi est une femme de 62 ans , qui est très dynamique, elle est veuve. l'activité qu'elle exerce pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens est le commerce de bois servant à fabriquer le cure dents. elle a commencé ce commerce en  1984. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit qui lui servira à acheter 16 bois pour fabriquer et vendre des cures dents.
texts.en:
Dovi is a 62-year old widow who is very dynamic. In order to provide for her daily needs she trades in wood which is used to make toothpicks. She began this business in 1984. Her customer base is made up of all types of people. She is requesting a first loan from WAGES which she will use to buy 16 pieces of wood to make into toothpicks and sell.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Edo

texts.fr: A. est un homme de 49 ans qui est marié et père de 2 enfants, il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'avepozo qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille il s'est lancée dans le commerce d'habits. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes et il s'approvisionne aux grand marché de Lomé. il veut dynamiser son stock pour acheter de nouvelles gammes de vêtements. il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 2 balles d'habits.
texts.en:
A., a 49 year-old married man with two children, lives with his family in the Avepozo neighborhood, a suburb of Lomé. To support his family he starting a clothing business. His clientele is composed of all types of people and serves clients in the large market in Lomé. He wants to boost his stock and buy new clothing lines. He asks for a loan through WAGES to buy two bales of clothing.

Translated from French by Katherine Evans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Saragoza

texts.es: Saragoza tiene 43 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ello tiene tres hijos; Ely, Roly y Dina, de 18, 15 y 13 años respectivamente. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en el poblado de Triboline, donde tienen su propia casa. Para Saragoza, su pasión está en el campo, ya que lo vive con gran intensidad y le gusta estar en contacto con la naturaleza, es por ello que ya tiene 26 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, en donde produce y comercializa cacao y frutas en general. Ella hace mucho hincapié en la diversificación  de productos, y lo viene realizando de manera exitosa, ya que es muy consciente que cada producto tiene sus temporadas, es por ello que no sufre pérdidas mensuales, sino ganancias considerables de lo cual comercial en su valle. Normalmente trabaja en compañía de su pareja, y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, pero en temporadas de cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones con la necesidad de que los pueda facilitar la extracción de su producto agrícola. Usualmente su producto de cacao los vende en los centros de acopio de su poblado, pero sus frutas los llevan a la ciudad de Ayacucho para que haga su respectiva venta. Su plan a futuro es comprar un carro, con el propósito de pueda ofrecer servicio de transporte público, ya que ello permitiría que tenga otros ingresos. Este es su decimosegundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está satisfecho con banco comunal, debido al buen clima cordial que existe en cada reunión mensual. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en los gastos educativos de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
43-year-old Saragoza lives with her husband and their 3 children: Ely, Roly and Dina, aged 18, 15 and 13 respectively. They live in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle, in the village of Triboline, where they own their own home.
Saragoza’s passion lies in the fields and she likes being in touch with nature. This is why she already has 26 years of farming experience, producing and selling cacao and various fruits. She has focused on diversifying her products, with much success. She is well aware that each product has its seasons, which is why she does not suffer monthly losses, but makes considerable profits in the valley.
She usually works with her husband, and together they make a good team, but at harvest time they hire labourers to help pick the crops. She usually sells cacao at the local collection centres, but she sells the fruit in Ayacucho. In the future, she plans to buy a car to offer public transportation services in order to generate additional income.
This is her 12th loan with MFP, which is why she is committed to repaying on time. She’s very happy with her communal bank thanks to the friendly atmosphere at their monthly meetings. With the requested loan, she plans to invest in her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education expenses for her children

loans.name: Carmen Araceli

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 11 años, vive junto a su madre en la zona urbana del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola caracterizada por tener una geografía accidentada debido a su cercanía con la sierra del país, se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y que ha luchado desde joven por sacar adelante a su hija, actualmente cuenta con un negocio de venta ambulante de golosinas y gaseosas que realiza en su distrito. Ella viene realizando esta actividad desde hace dos años y durante este tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo gracias a la acogida de sus clientes, en su mayoría niños y jóvenes de la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual viene percibiendo ingresos adicionales que utiliza en solventar los gastos familiares y de educacion de su hija.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio de venta de gaseosas y golosinas con la compra de mas productos que le permitan ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias, asimismo desea brindar mantenimiento a su  mototaxi para que siga funcionando sin problemas. Por este motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar pot primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es ver a su hija convertida en una profesional exitosa. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Carmen, 34, is a single mother of an 11-year-old daugther. She lives with her mother in the urban zone of Oyotún district, an agricultural area known for its rugged geography due to its proximity to the country’s mountains. It is located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Carmen is a hard working woman who has struggled since she was young to raise her daughter. She currently has an ambulatory business where she sells soft drinks and snacks in her district. She has been in this line of work for two years and her business has grown during this time thanks to the welcome she’s gotten from customers most of whom are children and youngsters in the area. She has a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a cabin attached allowing for passenger and cargo transport) that is producing extra income that she uses to meet family expenses and her daughter’s education’s costs. She would like to expand her soft drink and snack sales business buying more products that will enlarge her stock and produce higher profits. She also wants to service the mototaxi so that it will continue to function problem-free. She has, therefore, approaced Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 2000 new sol loan. Her greatest wish is to see her daughter become a successful professional. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Soñadoras Group

texts.es:
“SOÑADORAS” es una asociación comunal que está incursionando en su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Santiago II, es considerada  aun nueva, por que ellas todavía no han experimentado todos los servicios financieros y diferentes vivencias que consolidan a los grupos, es por esto que requieren de un cuidado especial de parte de las asesoras de crédito.

La señora Juana es la presidenta de la asociación.  Ella comenta que  conoció a Pro Mujer debido a la movilización del personal. 
El negocio que tiene es “artesanía en cuadro”, utiliza como materia prima las varillas, que son compradas en la zona 16 de Julio, debido a que elabora su producto a pedido, la elaboración y las ventas son realizadas en su domicilio.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que la atención del consultorio.

Los integrantes de la asociación comunal, cuentan con negocios diferentes, como por ejemplo: venta de ropa, mecánica electricista, artesanías, imprenta, venta de pollos y costura.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Soñadoras” (Dreamers) is starting its second loan cycle as part of the Santiago II Community Center. They are still considered to be a new group because they have not had the chance to participate in all of the financial services and different experiences needed to unite the members together. For this reason, special care has been taken to provide them with credit counseling.

Sra. Juana is the President of this Association. She says she encountered Pro Mujer as a result from a visit from its staff. Juana has a craft business in which she produces decorative wall hangings. The main material she uses are wooden rods that she buys in the July 16th district. She produces and sells her products from her home according to her orders. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Juana replied that she enjoys the medical services.

The members of the Communal Assocation are involved in different business such as selling clothing, providing electrical services, producing handicrafts, printing, sewing, and selling chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wooden rods for making wall art

loans.name: Yaky

texts.es: Yaky, de 23 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Edeuterio de 28 años y de sus 2 pequeños que estudian en el colegio, juntos desean salir adelante, habitan en un populoso barrio ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de lencería, tanto para damas como para caballeros. Trabaja en su casa y con pedidos, y en el negocio le va bien pues ya tiene clientes fijos que le compran de vez en cuando la ropa interior que ofrece, porque es de  buena calidad. Además siempre le ha gustado el trabajo de ventas, pues tiene buena capacidad de persuasión y convence rápidamente a sus clientes. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene grandes planes para seguir en la comercialización, como el de instalar una tienda de venta de lencería en algún gran centro comercial de la  zona por donde vive. Pero sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá salir adelante, y continuara ayudando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas, pues quiere continuar en su negocio hasta alcanzar el progreso, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero. Yaky tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en lencería, pues quiere ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, y para lograrlo comprará al por mayor en la ciudad y lo ofrecerá por la zona donde vive a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Yaky is 23 years old and lives in her own home alongside her husband Edeuterio, age 28, and their two young children who are in school. Together they wish to get ahead. Yaky and her family live in a crowded neighborhood to the north of the city. For the past two years she has been selling undergarments and lingerie for women as well as men. She sells from her home and also takes orders. Her business has done very well since she has established customers who buy whenever she has undergarments available to offer since these products are of good quality. Yaky has always enjoyed working in sales because she has good persuasive skills and is able to convince her customers to make quick decisions. Being an enterprising woman, she has grand plans for the future to continue her sales such as opening a large lingerie shop at a shopping center where she lives. She knows it will take a great deal of effort and dedication to get ahead and continue supporting her husband with the household expenses.

This is her first loan with MFP. Yaky promises to complete her payments on time because she wants to continue making progress with her business. She is extremely grateful to everyone who made this loan possible. Yaky plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of merchandise, such as lingerie, so that she can offer variety to her customers. This will allow her to buy in bulk in the city and then offer the goods in her area at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana tiene 51 años, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Residen en el poblado de Triboline, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su casa propia. Feliciana se dedica actualmente a la actividad agrícola, específicamente a la producción y comercialización de cacao y café, en donde obtiene buena cosecha, por algo tiene 24 años de experiencia en el rubro agrícola. Hoy tiene muchos clientes fieles, debido a la calidad y puntualidad de entrega del producto de café que da a sus compradores, además sus ventas vienen mejorando con el pasar de los años. Por lo general recibe el apoyo de sus hijos, cuando ellos disponen de su tiempo libre, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de peones para que le faciliten en la selección y recolección de cacao y café, que luego son llevados a los centros de acopio de su propio poblado para su respectiva venta. Su mayor anhelo es seguir ampliando su producción, con la necesidad de que pueda mejorar en cuanto a ingresos y calidad de vida. Este es su décimo segundo  crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además esta satisfecho por el buen trabajo de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos, para aplicar a sus campos de café y cacao, de esa manera asegura una buena productividad.
texts.en:
Feliciana, 51, is a widow and has four school age children. They live in Triboline in the Peruvian highland jungle where she has her own house. Feliciana is a farmer; specifically she grows cacao and coffee to sell. She produces a good harvest thanks to her 24 years farming experience. She has many regular customers due to the quality and punctuality of her coffee deliveries. Besides, her sales have been improving as years have gone by. Her children usually help her during their free time but during harvest she hires laborers that make reaping and coffee and cacao gathering easier. The product is later taken to her town’s gathering centers for sale. Her greatest wish is to continue to expand production so that she can increase income and thus improve her quality of life. This is her 12th loan with MFP and she commits to continue to pay in a timely fashion. She is satisfied with the good work of her communal bank. She plans to use the requested funds to buy supplies and manure for her coffee and cacao fields thus generating good productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and supplies to improve cacao and coffee production.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia Vive en la ciudad de Santa  Cruz en el Barrio la Morita,  es nacida en la Comunidad de Camiri, considerada la capital petrolera de Santa Cruz, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar su esposo trabaja en una empresa, como técnico en construcción civil, ambos trabajan duro para sacar adelante a su familia y también porque están  pagando su casa por lo que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza para sostener a su familia, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería en cosméticos por catalogo, ella aprovecha los productos que se encuentran en promoción ya que están baratos y después lo vende al precio original, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in Santa Cruz’s La Morita neighborhood. She was born in Camiri, considered to be Santa Cruz’s petroleum capital. She has two school age children. Her husband works as a Civil Construction Technician for a private firm. Both work hard to support their family and also because they are paying for their house and her husband’s salary is insufficient to support the family. The loan will be used to buy catalogue cosmetics. She takes advantage of items that are on sale and thus inexpensive to later resell them at their original price. She is very grateful to the institution for the help provided.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy catalogue beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Léocadie

texts.fr: O. locadi est une femme âgée mais très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de glaçons et de jus de fruits. elle est dans ce commerce depuis 1990. actuellement son réfrigérateur est en panne, elle veut acheter un nouveau raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour pouvoir acheter 1 réfrigérateur
texts.en:
Léocadie O. is a very energetic woman in spite of her age. She is married and the mother of three children. She earns a living by selling ice cubes and fruit juice. She has been in this business since 1990. At present her refrigerator is broken, and she would like to purchase a new one, which is why she is seeking a loan from WAGES.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a refrigerator

loans.name: María Ysabel

texts.es:
María Ysabel es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en la zona urbana de Oyotún, un distrito agrícola caracterizado por presentar una geografia accidentada debido a la cercanía con la sierra del país, la zona se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que tiene instalada en su vivienda. El negocio tiene mucha acogida ya que ella trata de ofrecerles productos de consumo diario en las mejores condiciones posibles, ya que como viven a gran distancia de la ciudad de Chiclayo, principal fuente de abasto de la región, el acceso a productos frescos muchas veces es muy limitado.

María trata de brindar a sus clientes un buen trato, esto ha hecho que su clientela aumente y que muchas veces los productos que ofrece no son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de su negocio. Para poder mejorar esta situación ella piensa ampliar su negocio adquiriendo una mayor cantidad de productos para lo cual ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Maria es una mujer bastante emprendedora y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is the mother of a family, 30 years old, and lives with her husband and their 2 children in the urban zone of Oyatun, an agricultural district characterized by a rugged geography due to its closeness to the country's sierra. The zone is located more than 1 ½ hours from the city of Chiclayo. Maria has for the last 2 years sold products of primary necessity and groceries in a store she installed in her home. The business has been widely recognized because she tries to offer customers consumer products daily in the best conditions possible, since they live at a great distance from the city of Chiclayo, the principal source of the region's supplies. Access to fresh products is often very limited. Maria tries to offer her customers good service, and this has led to a growth in clientele, such that, often, the products she offers are insufficient to satisfy her business's demand. To be able to improve this situation, she intends to expand her business, acquiring a larger quantity of products. For that reason, she has approached Edpyme Alternative for the first time for a loan of 1,000 new sols. Maria is a very enterprising and hard-working woman, whose greatest hope is to continue growing as a business person, in order to offer her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRODUCTS OF PRIMARY NECESSITY AND GROCERIES TO EXPAND HER STORE IN HER HOUSE

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: CRISTO REY D. NICOLAS D. PIEROLA

Mery Z. C., mujer hacendosa y trabajadora, con 05 hijos, 04 casados y una soltera, se dedica a vender variedades D. alimentos como picarones, tamales y mazamorras, también trabaja con productos D. belleza AVON y calzados para caballeros y niños (pedidos), ella lleva trabajando 02 años,  para asumir gastos D. medicina para su salud, antes lo hacía cuando se le requería o por necesidad, ahora lo hace continuamente, Del mismo modo, elabora tejidos (pedidos), como ponchos, chalinas, chompas para niños; a Mery siempre le ha gustado ser negociante.
Gracias a su dedicación y el apoyo financiero y económico D. EDAPROSPO, ella ha logrado mejorar su negocio, D. igual forma pudo comprar sus cosas, como refrigerador, juego D. comedor y otros utensilios D. primera necesidad para su hogar. Así se esfuerza día a día por mejorar sus servicios  y quedar bien con los clientes, sus hijos colaboran para los gastos D. su medicina,  y están siempre pendientes D. ella en todo momento, con el préstamo que le otorgará EDAPROSPO lo invertirá para comprar calzados al por mayor y venderlos por pedidos. Con el tiempo ella sueña tener una dulcería y un restaurant y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
“CRISTO REY D. NICOLAS D. PIEROLA” COMMUNAL BANK Mery Z. C. is a hard working, dutiful woman. She has five children four of whom are married and one is still single. She sells a variety of foods like: picarones (pumpkin and sweet potato doughnuts), tamales and mazamorras (corn-based pastry). She also works selling AVON products and shoes for men and children (on order). She has been working for two years in order to afford medicine for her health. She used to do it only when required to meet some special need but now she does it continuously. At the same time she makes weavings (on order) like ponchos, scarves and sweaters for children. Mery has always enjoyed being a businesswoman. Thanks to her dedication and financial and economic support from EDAPROSPO she has improved her business. She was also able to buy a few things like a refrigerator, a dining room set and other necessary utensils for the home. She strives daily to improve service and satisfy customers. Her children help her pay for her medicine and are always watching over her. She will use the loan that EDAPROSPO will grant to buy shoes at wholesale for subsequent resale on order. In time she’d like to have a candy shop and a restaurant to earn higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes at wholesale for subsequent retail resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Awareness Group

texts.en:
Isatu M. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 43 years ago in Makeni city, Isatu is married and has two children attending primary school. For a very long time, Isatu has been selling soap and clothes. She is requesting a loan of 800,000 leones in order to buy more soap and clothes to add to her business.

This is not the first loan that Isatu and her group members have applied for from SMT, a partner of Kiva.org. With the help of their loans, these entrepreneurs can expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy clothes and soap in large quantity

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 26 años, ella vive con su esposo y su hija de 6 años en casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al bordado y tejido, actividad que le enseñaron su familia y ahora produce bellos trabajos con calidad que son usados en las danzas típicas de su ciudad. De esta manera esta aportando en la economía de su hogar al mismo tiempo que atiende a su pequeña hija que esta estudiando. Es así que Lilia realiza este trabajo en su misma y las ganancias que percibe son rentables, por tal motivo desea producir cantidad de fustanes bordados aprovechando las épocas festivas que se acercan. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de lana por fardos, telas e hilos para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Lilia is 26 years old and lives at her in-laws’ house, along with her husband and six year old daughter. She’s been knitting and embroidering for the past four years; a trade she learned from her family and now she produces beautiful quality works that are used in traditional dances throughout the city. In this way she can contribute to the household finances and care for her young daughter who attends school. Lilia’s sales are profitable and she wants to make large quantities of embroidered skirts, so that she can take advantage of the approaching festive seasone. This will be her third loan through MFP, and she’s glad to know that she has financial support. She’s always been responsible with her payments and is happy to be a part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and united people. She appreciates those who make this loan possible and it will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the money from this loan to buy bales of yarn, fabrics, and thread so that she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Maane

texts.en: Maane N. cooks rice for sale. She also sells secondhand clothing in Elmina. Maane not received any formal education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a prison officer. Maane has been selling rice and secondhand clothes for 25 years. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy additional foodstuffs to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to cook for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Gilma Isabel

texts.es: Gilma Isabel S. N. de 37 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil y junto a dos hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad. Gilma trabaja en su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda en la que se comercializan productos de primera necesidad como pan, agua, gas propano, medicinas y algunas golosinas, y su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Gilma desea mucho el poder surtir en gran medida su negocio, ya que de esta forma podrá vender más y obtener más ganancias, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios para brindarles todo lo que sus clientes buscan, de esta forma ella podrá brindar un mejor servicio el cual se vea recompensado con más clientes. Para Gilma su negocio es muy importante ya que cuenta con la ventaja de poseerlo en su hogar lo cual le permite atenderlo y así mismo estar junto a sus hijos a los cuales al mismo tiempo les puede brindar todo lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Gilma Isabel S. N. is 37 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, located in the Usulután department. She lives with her husband, who works as a mason, and her two children, ages 14 and 17. Gilma has her own business where she runs a store out of her home, selling primary needs products, such as bread, water, propane gas, medication, and some sweets. Gilma would very much like to stock her business in order to be able to increase her sales and earnings. She is requesting this loan in order to buy all the products to give her customers all that they need, be able to improve her service, and be rewarded with more customers. Gilma’s business is very important to her and it gives her the advantage of being located in her home, which allows her to tend to it and be with her children, while at the same time providing for all of their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es: María Jesús M. G. 48 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilobasco ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas, vive junto a sus dos sobrinos de 18 y 12 años de edad, los cuales no solo se dedican a estudiar sino también a ayudarle a María con los quehaceres del hogar como también a atender el negocio. María es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, que ha pesar que desempeña tanto el rol de madre como el de padre, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ya que sus dos sobrinos cuentan con todo lo necesario y así mismo se dedican a estudiar gracias a los enormes esfuerzos de María. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan y golosinas, y también   de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo, y también comercializa verduras a las afueras de su casa. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, y verduras, de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
María Jesús M. G. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Ilobasco, located in the Cabañas department. She lives with her two nephews, ages 18 and 12. Both of them attend school and also help María with the household chores and help tend the business. María is a very responsible and hard working mother who fills the role of both mother and father and who has managed to move her family ahead. Her nephews have all they need and are able to attend school, thanks to María’s enormous efforts. She has a store where she sells food items, such as bread, sweets, and other things such as ham, and shampoo. She also sells vegetables right outside her home. María is asking for this loan so that she can stock her store a bit more by buying large quantities of corn, and vegetables so that she can better tend to her customers’ needs and increase her sales. Getting ahead with her family is a priority for her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married and has three children. She has attained a senior high school level of education. Ekua sells bananas, moving from one area to another in Elmina. Her husband is a mason. Ekua uses her income to help her husband with the feeding, clothing and sheltering of the family. Ekua will use this loan to purchase extra fruits for sale. Ekua plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to invest in the sale of other kinds of fruits.

loans.use: To purchase extra fruits for sale

loans.name: Ney Laurentino

texts.es:
Ney de 36 años, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas, tiene un puesto de venta de encebollado (plato típico del ecuador). 

Desde pequeño el comenzó a preparar encebollado para tener su propio negocio. Con esfuerzo obtuvo un puesto de comida en una principal comercial. Poco a poco a mantenido a su familia, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 00h00pm. El encebollado contiene pescado, cebollas, yucas, llevar, es común en el desayuno.    

Para poder hacer mas encebollado el quiere comprar con el préstamo pescado y un congelador. En el futuro quiere tener un local y ser reconocido en el mercado de comidas típicas.
texts.en:
Ney is 36 years old and lives in an urban area called “Las Orquídeas,” (The Orchids) named so because there were many orchids in the area when it was first discovered.
