He has a food stall where he sells “encebollado” (a typical Ecuadorean dish). He’s been cooking encebollado since he was very young, so that he could have his own business. With great effort, he obtained his food stall in a main commercialized zone. Little by little he’s been able to support his family. He works from 8:00 AM to midnight. Encebollado is made with fish, onions, and yucca and is a common breakfast food. He wants to use the money from this loan to buy more fish and a freezer. In the future he wants to have a small eatery and become known in the food market.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish and refrigerator

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. is into the sale of secondhand clothing in Elmina. She has not received any formal education. She is divorced and takes care of four children. She has been in her business for ten years now. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional secondhand clothes to sell. She anticipates using the new profit from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy additional secondhand clothes for sale

loans.name: Jesús Alberto

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus costumbres y danzas afro – peruanas, se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de animales menores desde hace mas de un año. El cría diversos animales domésticos, especialmente aves de corral como patos y gallinas. El cría estos animales en diversos ambientes ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando sus aves alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los diversos negociantes que visitan la zona con frecuencia.

Jesús desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales y de alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de los mismos, además desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales. Con estos cambios el planea aumentar sus ganancias y poder apoyar a su familia en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jesus es conocido en la zona por ser un joven tranquilo y que no tiene problemas con nadie. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo comoempresario para poder apoyar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jesús is 19 years old, single and lives with his parents in the district of Zaña, a district known at the regional level for its customs and Afro-Peruvian dance, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has worked selling young animals for more than a year and raises different domestic animals, especially poultry, like ducks and chickens. He raises these animals in different environments located in the back of his house, feeding them grains and natural grasses. When his birds reach a good level of development, he sells them to his neighbors and different businessmen that visit the area regularly.

Jesús wants to expand his business by purchasing more animals and feed to improve his rearing of them. In addition, he wants to make some improvements in the animal pens. With these changes, he plans to increase his earnings and be able to support his family in being able to pay the family expenses. In order to achieve his goal, he believes it to be worthwhile to request a loan of 1500 PEN. This is his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

Jesús is known in the area for being a calm boy and does not have problems with anyone. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to be able to support his family to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase birds and balanced feed to make improvements in his business of raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua E. is divorced. She is into the production and distribution of palm oil in Elmina. She takes care of five dependants. She has been in this trade for quite some time now. Ekua uses her income for the general upkeep of her home. Ekua will use this loan to purchase more palm fruits to process for sale. Ekua plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to enter into the sale of foodstuffs.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to process for sale

loans.name: Charllote Ekua

texts.en: Charllote Ekua A. is married to a security man and lives together with her four children. She has received senior high school education. She sells raw maize and makes kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) in Elmina. She uses the income generated from her sales to help feed the entire family. She plans to use this loan to purchase more bags of maize to sell and to cook. Charllote plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. sells foodstuffs such as okro, tomatoes, garden eggs and more at Elmina. Aba has not received any form of education. She is divorced and has four children. She has been selling foodstuffs for three years. She responsibly pays her children’s school fees and makes sure that they are in good health. Her loan will be used to buy more goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Magniba

texts.fr: M. est une femme célibataire qui vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de kagnikopé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. elle exerce depuis 6 ans déjà le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et dans le marché locale d'akodessewa tous les mercredis et samedi. elle veut gonfler son stock qui s'épuise raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui est son deuxième pour l'achat de 3 sacs de riz, 3 bidons d'huile, 1 carton de riz GINO, 1 carton de sardine, 1 carton de lait Peak et divers.
texts.en:
M. is a single woman who lives with her family in the district of Kagnikopé, an outlying area of the city of Lomé. She has been selling foodstuffs for six years already. She buys her merchandise at the big open-air market in Lomé and in the local market at Akodessewa on Wednesdays and Saturdays. She would like to expand her stock which is low, and that is why she asked WAGES for a loan--her second one--to buy three sacks of rice, 3 jerrycans of oil, 1 case of GINO rice, 1 case of sardines, 1 case of PEAK milk, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying groceries for resale

loans.name: Hede

texts.en: Hede M. sells corn dough and maize at Elmina. She is married and takes care of three children. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a farmer. Hede uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Hede will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to prepare corn dough for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hede plans to save to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to prepare corn dough to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. sells salt at Elmina. Efua has received junior high education.  She is a widow taking care of four children. She has been in this business for eight years. She responsibly ensures that her family is well taken care of. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of salt to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of salt to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina T. sells frozen chicken and fish at Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. Georgina has no educational background. She is responsible for helping her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more varieties of frozen foods to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy land.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of frozen foods to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Esi Ayibe

texts.en: Esi Ayibe A. is married to a teacher and has a child. She has received senior high education.  Esi prepares fante kenkey to sell at Elmina. Esi uses her income to help her husband provide the basic needs of the family. Esi will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare kenkey to sell

loans.name: Maame Efua

texts.en: Maame Efua K. sells charcoal and firewood in Elmina. She is married and has four children. She has attained a junior high school level of education. Her husband is a security man. Maame uses her income to help her husband take care of the children. Maame will use this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Maame plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame M. is a hairdresser at Elmina. Maame has not received any form of education. She is divorced and has two children. She responsibly makes sure that her children are well taken care of. Her loan will be used to buy more hair creams to treat her customer's hair. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more hair creams to treat her customer's hair.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame S. is married and has three children. She has been through junior high school. Maame operates a provisions store and sells wakye at Elmina. Her husband is a mason. Maame uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. Maame will use the loan to purchase more beans and rice to prepare wakye to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and rice to prepare wakye to sell

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha Q. is married with five dependents and her husband is a mason. She has been through junior high school.

Agatha is a fishmonger at Elmina and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua M. sells cassava and plantain at Elmina. She has not been educated. She is married to a mason and has seven dependents.

Efua has been selling cassava and plantain for ten years now and responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more plantain and cassava for sale. She hopes to reinvest her profit in her business.

loans.use: To buy more plantain and cassava to sell

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa L. is divorced and has six dependents. She has been through junior high school.

Adjowa smokes fish for sale at Elmina and uses her income in taking care of her dependents. She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to provide a good education for her dependents.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. sells maize, corn dough and smoked fish at Elmina. She has received junior high education. She is married a security man and has four children.

Nana responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare corn dough for sale. She hopes to reinvest her increased profit in her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare corn dough for sale

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. is married to a driver and has five dependents. She has no educational background.

Maame sells provisions and soft drinks at Elmina and uses her income to support her husband in the general welfare of the home. She will use the loan to purchase more provisions for sale.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa N. sells provisions, banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) and rice at Elmina. She has received senior high education. She is a widow and has eight dependents.

Adjoa has been selling provisions, banku and rice for two years and responsibly takes care of her family with the income she gets from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced and has two daughters. She is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk who makes a living selling clothing in a local marketplace in her home town. The items she sells include terrycloth robes, pullovers, sweaters and jackets. She has been in this business for 11 years, and opened her small company after being downsized out of a job at a manufacturing company. She decided to try her luck in business and has been so successful that presently her monthly profit comes to about 8,000 Grivnyas.  

Oksana is applying for a loan for 8,000 Grivnyas to buy a variety of new items to sell to her customers. She lives with younger daughter and dreams of some day being able to buy her a home.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of terrycloth robes and sweaters to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. sells fish at Elmina. She has received senior high education. She is married to a farmer and takes care of five dependents. She supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

Aba’s loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She anticipates using the new profit from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: David Fernando

texts.es: El Señor David vive en el barrio Porvenir del Municipio del el Torno de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, hace 19 años que llego desde el departamento de Chuquisaca capital de Bolivia  en busca de tiempos mejores para su familia, su esposa con la cual tienen un hijo, en edad escolar, por lo que  se dedica al cuidado de su hijo; su actividad principal es el de la construcción se dedica a esta actividad hace dos años, el destino del crédito solicitado es para construcción de su domicilio, necesita comprar material de construcción como cemento, pintura, tejas, etc. , esta agradecido con la institución ya que le da la oportunidad de seguir creciendo económicamente y así tener un futuro mejor para su familia
texts.en:
David lives in the Porvenir neighborhood of the el Torno municipality in the City of Santa Cruz. He arrived there 19 years ago from the Chuquisaca department, the capital of Bolivia in search of better times for his family. He and his wife have a son, who is school age, therefore she looks after their son. His main business activity is building and he has done this for two years. The loan requested will be used for building his home, and he needs to buy building material such as cement, painting, tiles, etc. He is grateful to the institution as it gave him the opportunity to continue growing financially and therefore have a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building material

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is married to a carpenter and they live with their two children. Adjoa has been through junior high school.

Adjoa sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), charcoal, cassava and plantain at Elmina and uses her income to help her husband in promoting the general wellbeing of her family. She will use the loan to purchase more cassava and plantain to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava and plantain to sell

loans.name: Volodymir

texts.en:
Volodymir is married and has a six-year-old son. He makes a living as a small businessman in the town Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine, by offering transportation services to many parts of his country. He has been in this business for six years, and his monthly income comes to about 5,000 Grivnyas. 

Volodymir is requesting a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to repair his vehicle. He relies on his car working smoothly to support his family, and really enjoys his job. He used to travel to Siberia to make his living, and appreciates the fact that his current job allows him to be close to his loved ones and make enough money to meet their needs. His main goal at present is to finish building his house, using a portion of income he believes he can earn once his car vehicle is repaired.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is married to a mason and has four children. She has received senior high education.

Adjoa sells fish, cassava and plantain at Elmina and has been in this business for seven years. She helps her husband in feeding and clothing her family.

Adjoa’s loan will be used to buy more of her goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 39 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jaime de 39 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Joel de 18 y Kevin de 16 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña Carmen aprendió a trabajar en la chacra, fue ahí donde asimiló todos los secretos para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra alverja, papa y gladiolos, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 39 years old, is a very simple and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Jaime who is 39 years old and their two dear sons, Joel, 18 and Kevin, 16 years old. She wants to provide her children with better living conditions. Carmen started learning to work in the farm when she was very young. It was where she learned all the secrets to a good crop. She now has her own land where she sows and cares for with a lot of love and patience. She sows peas, potatoes and gladioli which she sells at Tarma's wholesale market. The thing she enjoys the most about her work is harvesting her crop since she can see that her hard work is giving fruit. She has been in this activity for 18 years and believes the hardest part of the work is taking care of the crop to prevent plagues from affecting it. Her biggest wish is to buy a car to transport her produce to the Tarma market. This is her first loan with MFP. She is aware that she needs to pay her installments on time and she is willing to do it. She is a very happy partner of her community bank and she is always offering the group a dose of humor. She will buy fertilizer for her land with the 3,000 nuevos soles she requests. She wishes her new seeds to give good fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fertilizer to cultivate her land

loans.name: Hector Daniel

texts.es:
Héctor de 65 años, tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas. 

Cuando se jubilo el comenzó con su papelería para tener un ingreso fijo. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido aumentar el negocio con unas cabinas telefónicas. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Vende papelería, cuadernos, plumas, laminas etc.  

El quiere con el préstamo comprar papelería y artículos de papelería etc. En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio y poderlo expandir.
texts.en:
65-year old Héctor runs a stationery store out of the front of his house. He lives in Las Orquídeas (The Orchids) neighbourhood, so called because when it was discovered, many orchids grew there. When Héctor retired, he started the store in order to have a regular income. Over time he managed to obtain several telephone booths and expand the business. He works from 7am to 10pm. He sells stationery, notebooks, pens, laminated sheets etc. He wishes to use the loan to buy stationery and other merchandise for the store. In the future he wants to continue running the business and to expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stationery etc.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es: Clorinda, de 44 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alfonso de 41 años, quien trabaja de obrero en una mina cercana a la ciudad de Huancayo y sus 3 hijos, a quienes desea darles una buena educación. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Clorinda sale a trabajar al campo, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son: papa, maíz, arveja y gladiolos, los cuales son vendidos al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar en la producción. Para el futuro, planea poner su propio puesto de ventas, en el mercado de Tarma, ya que esto le generará mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más semillas de arvejas, también comprará abono para cuidar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
44-year old Clorinda is a simple, hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband 41-year old Alfonso who is a labourer in a mine close to the town of Huancayo. They have three children and wish to provide them with a good education. Early every day Clorinda leaves the house to work in her fields. She doesn’t take any days off as there is always work to be done if she wishes to have a good harvest. She grows mainly potatoes, corn, peas, and gladioli flowers which she sells wholesale in the town of Tarma. Most of all Clorinda likes the freedom she has out in her fields where she can enjoy the green countryside. She’s been doing this work for 24 years. The most difficult part of her job is dealing with the insects which can ruin her crops. Her future plans include running her own stall in the market in Tarma as she would earn more money by doing so. This is her seventh loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she has always made her repayments on time. She expects to continue doing so. Among the members of her community bank Clorinda is well-liked as she is a very cheerful person. With the 3,000 soles loan she plans to buy more pea seeds as well as fertilizer to put on her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy peas and fertilizer

loans.name: Cecilia Milagritos

texts.es:
Cecilia es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona pesquera ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre, perteneciente a la provincia de La Libertad y ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de dulces, ella prepara diversos dulces en su vivienda y los ofrece en un kiosko ambulante que ubica en diversas zonas estratégicas, como por ejemplo los parques y plazas, también aprovecha diversas festividades y celebraciones de las localidades aledañas como Chepén y San Pedro de Lloc para ofrecer su producto. Esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre seesmerapor mantener su negocio de la mejor manera posible.

Cecilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de nas insumos para seguir elaborando dulces, de modo que pueda ampliar su negocio, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Cecilia es una mujer trabajadora y bastante responsable. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
36-year old Cecilia lives with her husband and children in Pacasmayo district, a fishing area located in the province of the same name. It belongs to La Libertad department, about an hour and a half from the town of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. Cecilia earns her living selling candies and other sweet items. She makes various types in her home and then sells them in different locations like parks and plazas from her barrow. Also when there are festivities and celebrations in distant places like Chepén and San Pedro de Lloc, she travels there to sell her products. Her job provides important income to the family so she goes to a lot of trouble to run the business as well as possible. She wishes to expand the business by buying more ingredients so she can continue making the candies. In order to do this she is seeking a loan of 800 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. Cecilia is a hardworking woman and extremely responsible. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has always been punctual and responsible with the loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 54 años, es una mujer muy sencilla, que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobresalir, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio de 60 años, quien es el compañero de toda su vida y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Las chacras que con tanto esfuerzo ha cultivado Julia, siempre le han brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, ella cultiva zanahoria, papa, gladiolos, que con la ayuda de su esposo lo lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios le dan por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos. En adelante, espera poder ampliar sus tierras, para poder sembrar más. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, y afirma que siempre ha sido muy puntual y desea serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más semillas de arveja, asimismo  comprará abono.
texts.en:
Julia is 54 years old. She is a simple woman who during her whole life has always worked to get ahead. She lives in her own home with her husband, Antonio, who is 60. He has been her life's companion for her whole life. What she wants the most is to have a calm old age. The fields that Julia has cultivated with so much work have always offered enough income to support her family. She grows carrots, potatoes, and gladiolas. With her husband's help she takes them to sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where the best prices are gotten for her products. What she likes the most about her work is sowing her land which she does with much patience. She has been doing this for 30 and considers the most difficult part of tending to her crops are the pests that can disturb them. In the future, she hopes to be able to enlarge her land to be able to plant more. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She affirms that she has always made her payments on time and she will this time as well. In her communal bank she is a member who is very committed to the group's development. With the five hundred nuevos soles that she is asking for, she will buy more pea seed, and in addition she will buy fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sirly Johana

texts.es:
Sirly de 24 años, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas. ElL. vende productos de uso personal por una revista de ropa llamadas Esika. 

Comenzó a trabajar por L. falta de oportunidades ya que no esta casada pero tiene hijo de dos años, inicio con el código de una de sus amigas en esta revistas, cuando realmente tubo L. oportunidad de ingresar como vendedora invirtió dinero y compro ropa para venderL. a sus amigos y conocidos. Ahora elL. no tiene horario fijo por lo que trabaja a toda hora. 

Para seguir con las ventas elL. quiere compra con el préstamo ropa y productos de uso personal como perfumes y cremas. En el futuro quiere ser una líder de ventas y poder comprar un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sirly, 24, lives in an urban zone called “Las Orquídeas” so called because when it was first discovered there were many orchids there. She sells Esika brand personal use items via a clothing catalogue. She started to work because employment opportunities were few. She isn’t married but has a two-year-old son. She started working using a friend of hers i.d. number with one of these catalogues. When she got the opportunity to enroll as a seller herself, she invested money and bought clothes to sell to her acquaintances and friends. Now she doesn’t have a fixed work schedule because she works at all hours. To continue with her sales she needs a loan to buy clothing and personal use items like perfumes and creams. In the future she’d like to be a sales leader and be able to buy a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una madre D. familia D. 50 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Chepén, una zona agrícola D. movimiento comercial considerable. Pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a mas D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se gana la vida junto a su esposo vendiendo huevos sancochados D. codorniz, esta actividad la realiza en un pequeño carrito con el que suele recorrer algunas calles D. su localidad, su esposo también trabaja D. la misma manera. Los huevos D. codorniz tienen bastante demanda debido a su elevado nivel D. nutrientes.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas huevos D. modo que sus ventas se puedan incrementar y pueda recibir mas ganancias, para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer tranquila y responsable. Sus vecinos y conocidos dan muy buenas referencias D. su persona. Su negocio siempre cuenta con clientes debido al buen trato con el que son atendidos.
texts.en:
María is a 50 year old mother who lives with her husband in Chepén district, an agricultural zone with considerable commercial activity. It is part of Chepén province, La Libertad region, located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She and her husband earn their livelihood selling boiled quail eggs from a little cart that wanders through some of their locality’s streets. Quail eggs are in high demand due to their high level of nutrients. María wants to expand her business buying more eggs so that her sales will increase thus earning higher profits. To reach her goal she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. María is a calm, responsible woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances give her very good personal references. Her business always has customers due to the pleasant way she treats them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quail eggs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita de 44 años, tiene un puesto de comida rápida y vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Comenzó con la idea de ayudar en los gastos familiares y opto por un puesto de comida rápida, vende bolones (plátanos aplastados con queso) papas rellenas (papas aplastadas con relleno de carne) etc. Tiene dos hijas una de 13 años y otra de 9 años, la mayor le ayuda a vender después de regresar del colegio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una cocina para poder producir mas comida rápida, en el futuro quiere tener mayor clientela para que su familia este bien económicamente.
texts.en:
Margarita, 44, has a fast food stand and lives in an urban zone called “Las Orquídeas,” so called because when it was discovered there were many orchids there. She started out with the idea of contributing to household expenses and opted on a fast food stand. She sells “bolones” (smashed bananas with cheese), “papas rellenas” (smashed potatoes stuffed with meat), etc. She has two daughters who are 13 and 9 years of age. Her oldest helps her tend to customers when she comes home from school. She wants to use the loan to buy a stove so that she can produce more fast food. In the future she’d like to have more customers so that her family will be OK economically.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stove.

loans.name: Juan Richard

texts.es:
Juan de 19 años, el tiene un taller de lubricadora para vehículos, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Inicio trabajando como lubricador en un taller de carros pero por la falta de oportunidades el decidió implementar un negocio de lubricación de automóviles ya que le gusto esta profesión. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener su clientela y tener dinero para mantener a su hija, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar lubricantes y aceites para carro y así dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener una empresa de servicios automovilísticos.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 19 years old, has an automobile lube workshop. He lives in an urban area called “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids). It got it name because when it was discovered, there where many orchids there. He began working as a lube technician in an auto repair workshop, but for a lack of opportunities there he decided to open his own lube shop, since he enjoys that profession. Little by little, and with a good deal of effort, he has been able to build up a clientele and earn enough money to support his daughter. He now works from 8:00am to 6:00pm. With the loan, he wants to purchase automobile lubricants and oils to be able to give better service to his customers. In the future, he wants to have an automobile service company.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lubricants, oils

loans.name: Jussely

texts.es:
Jussely, de 26 años, es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Roger de 28 años y su querida hija Ángela de 6 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que se dedica Jussely, es el cultivo de choclo, papa, arveja, en las chacras que heredó sus padres, ella trabaja todos los días arduamente, para luego llegado el momento adecuado, cosechar sus productos y venderlos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que la mayoría de veces, le es muy difícil conseguir un carro que quiera llevarla. Para más adelante, espera poner un puesto en el mercado, ya que está segura que así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, como la ha sido en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y esta muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus grupos. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo actualmente muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Jussely who is 26 years old, is a young and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Roger, who is 28 years old, and their dear daughter Ángela, who is 6 years old. They are the reason behind all her efforts. Jussely makes her living cultivating corn, potatoes and peas on the small farm that she inherited from her parents. She works arduously every day so that later, when the right moment arrives, she can harvest her crop and sell it at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has in carrying it out. She is the one who decides what is best for her crops. She has been doing this work for 9 years. She feels that the most difficult part is transporting her products to the market, since most of the time it is difficult for her to find a ride. In the future, she hopes to have her own stall in the market, since she is sure it would be a way to improve her income. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She knows that she will need to be timely with her payments, like she has been with her previous loans. She is a supportive member of her communal bank and is very committed to development of the groups. With the 2500 PEN ($900USD) that she is requesting, she will purchase pea seed, since that leguminous plant is currently selling very well at market.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a member of the communal bank which is known as “Sembrando Futuro” (Seeding for the Future). She lives in a commune called de Puente Alto which is located north of Santiago, Chile. For the last 33 years, she has supported herself by crocheting and embroidering tablecloths, blankets, bed covers and other items.  She eagerly learned new ways to do this in two recent courses which were offered for free by a local church and a group of nuns. 

Laura went into business when she became a widow who needed to support her four children, the youngest of whom was only a year and a half old.  Now Laura is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine which will allow her to make boarders and new types of items.  She dreams of one day owning a fabric and embroidery shop and employing workers. She enjoys being a member of our communal bank because our meetings help her meet new friends and learn new things.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mari

texts.es: Mari, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Jeremías de 25 años, quien trabaja como obrero en una mina de la zona y sus dos menores hijos, a los cuales desea dar una buena educación. La siembra de papa, choclo y arveja, es la actividad a la que se dedica Mari. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, trabaja en sus chacras para hacerlas más fértiles, para que así sus cultivos sean más abundantes y tenga más productos para llevar a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden malograr sus sembríos, lleva 19 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que tiene que llevarlos con mucho cuidado. Con el tiempo, desea poner un puesto de ventas, con el cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, también comprará abono para cuidar sus chacras.
texts.en:
Mari, 34, is an unassuming, cheerful woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Jeremías, 25, who works as a laborer in a local mine and her two minor children for whom she wants to provide a good education. Mari farms potatoes, corn and peas. She goes out to work her fields every day very early in the morning to make them more fertile so that her crops will be more abundant and she’ll have more product to take to sell in Tarma’s wholesale market. What she likes best about the work is caring that her crops don’t become infested with pests that can damage the plants. She has been farming for 19 years and what she considers to be the most difficult part of it is transporting her products to market because she must do so with much care. In time, she’d like to set up a sales stand to increase her income. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She knows that she must repay on time and is willing to do so. She is very committed to her communal bank’s group development. She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy pea seeds and manure to care for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seeds and manure.

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr:
SAYE K. est une femme de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses deux frères et deux sœurs. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR KHALY depuis le 23 mars 2002. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de thioups et de mangues. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience en matière de petit commerce pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plus de 10 ans. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter sa quantité d'approvisionnement afin d'accroître ses revenus financiers.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale et l'entretien de la maison
texts.en:
Saye K. is a 58-year old woman. She is married and the mother of six children. She also supports her two brothers and two sisters. She has been a member of the Banc Villagois of Keur Khaly since March 23, 2002. She sells “thioups” [traditional dyes’ cloth and mangoes. She has plenty of experience as she has been in this business for over 10 years. WIth this new loan, she is going to expand her stock of goods in order to increase her income. Her goal is to help her husband in providing for the family and household needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing traditional "thioup" cloth and mangoes, for resale

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive independientemente en la casa de su madre, junto a su esposo Andrés de 41 años, quien trabaja de obrero en una mina y sus 2 hijos, a quienes desea dar una buena educación. El arduo trabajo que Marlene realiza en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus cultivos sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos, los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene buenos precios por sus productos, ya que tiene clientes muy fieles, quienes le compran todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar en la producción, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, puesto que el transporte es muy escaso. Para más adelante, desea tener un puesto de ventas en el mercado mayorista, donde pueda vender ella misma sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de gladiolo y de arveja, también comprará abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Marlene, 38, is a loving and hard working mother. She lives independently in her mother’s house with her husband, Andrés, 41, who works as a laborer in a mine, and her two children for whom she wants to provide a good education. The hard work Marlene puts into her fields has resulted in productive and abundant crops. She sells her products in Tarma’s wholesale market where she gets good prices for her goods because she has regular customers who buy everything at wholesale. What she likes best about her work is safeguarding her crops from insect infestations that can affect yields. She has been farming for 26 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to transport her products to market because transportation services are very scarce. For later on she’d like to have a sales stand in the wholesale market where she can sell her products herself. This is her 4th loan with MFP. She knows that she must make every installment payment on time and is willing to do so. She is a cheerful and mutually supportive member of her communal bank. She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy gladiolus and pea seeds as well as manure for her fields

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea and gladiolus seeds as well as sacks of manure.

loans.name: Maurent Ilosva

texts.es: La Señorita Maurent  dedicada a la venta de Variedad de productos como peines trabas, horquillas  gogos  todo para el arreglo del cabello y demás cositas que les gusta a las niñas y niños ya que ella vende  frente a un  colegio, esta venta lo realiza de lunes a viernes durante todo el día esta actividad le permite alimentarse y ayudar a su familia pues solo cuenta con su madre y tres hermanos menores a ella, a los que tiene  que apoyar moral y económicamente, la señorita requiere el crédito para la compra de distintos productos y así surtir su puesto para incrementar su capital y así tener ingresos mas considerables, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Maurent sells a variety of products like: combs, hairpins, hair brooches, hair bands, etc. and all those other kinds of things that little girls and boys like, in front of a school. She is open for business all day from Monday through Friday. This activity makes it possible for her to feed herself and help her family for she only has her mother and three younger siblings who she has to support both emotionally and economically. She needs funds to buy various products to stock her business thus increasing income considerably. She is very grateful to the institution for the help given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es:
Martha de 46 años, tiene una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa vende todo tipo de víveres, no esta casada pero tiene un hijo. Ella vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido surtir la tienda que hace años era un pequeño puesto de víveres. Por ahora trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 22h30pm todos los días. Vende todo tipo de víveres. La libra de arroz la vende a $ 0.40, aceite a $ 1.10, la libra de azúcar a $ 0.40, bebidas etc. 

Para seguir surtiendo su negocio y que incremente la clientela ella quiere comprar con el préstamo un congelador para las carnes, bebidas y víveres. En el futuro quiere tener mas clientela y ayudar a su hijo con los gastos universitarios.
texts.en:
Martha, 46, is not married but has a son. She has a store in front of her house and sells all kinds of food. Martha lives in an urban area called “Las Orquídeas,” so named because the region had many orchid flowers when it was discovered. With a lot of effort and dedication Martha has been able to expand her store, which only years ago, was a small food stand. The store now operates from 6:30 am until 10:30 pm every day. She sells all kinds of food, for example a pound of rice sells for $0.40, oil for $1.10, and a pound of sugar for $0.40 etc. To continue her business and increase the number of customers, Martha plans to use the requested loan to buy a freezer for meat, beverages, and supplies. In the future, she hopes to have more customers and help her son with college expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer, rice, and oils.

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Geremias tiene 51 años esta casado y tiene 03 hijos siempre ha sido un padre muy responsable y trabajador  durante mucho tiempo   laboro en el rubro de restaurantes  su trabajo era atención al publico pero siempre estaba atento  para aprender como se preparaban los distintos platos que ofrecían  su meta siempre fue tener su propio negocio de comida a pesar que su familia muchas veces lo desanimo para que no siga  con su proyecto el renuncio a su trabajo y lo hizo realidad  se compro algunos enseres y empezó su negocio, hizo un lugar en la puerta de su casa donde todos los días saca su negocio , tiene mucho éxito con la venta de hamburguesas, pollo Broster,alitas etc. lo que le  diferencia de los demás  es la calidad de productos y la buena atención que ofrece a su clientela, lo que quiere lograr mas adelante es terminar la construcción de su casa  y poner una fuente de soda su préstamo le servirá para surtir su negocio y comprar sus insumos como aceite por galones, hamburguesas, hot dog etc. de esa manera ahorra y sus ganancias mejoran. actualmente es el presidente del grupo “LA FORTALEZA” formado por 12 socios.
texts.en:
Geremias, 51, is married and has three children. He has always been a very responsible father and worker. He has worked in the restaurant sector for a long time and his work has gotten the public's attention as he has always been attentive in learning how to prepare the different dishes that the restaurants offer. His goal has always been to have his own food business even though his family has discouraged him many times to not follow through with this project. He left his job and made his dream a reality by buying some equipment to start his business. He works in his home and every day brings him business. He has had much success with selling hamburgers, chicken wings, etc. What differentiates him from his competitors is the quality of his products and the good service he provides to his customers. What he hopes to accomplish later on is finishing the construction on his house and putting in a soda fountain. His loan will be used to buy products such as oil by the gallon, hamburgers, hot dogs, etc. He hopes to save and increase his profits. Geremias is currently the president of the community bank, La Fortaleza, which includes 12 members.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, hamburgers, hot dogs, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor de 34 años y su pequeña hija Rosali, con quien posa alegremente en la foto. Desde muy pequeña, Mercedes aprendió a trabajar con la tierra, ya que la agricultura es una labor que ha estado en su familia desde hace muchos años. Ella aprendió esta actividad de sus padres y ahora tiene sus propios sembríos, en los cuales cultiva papa, choclo y arvejas, los cuales vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus campos, ya que así tendrá productos para vender dentro de 6 meses, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar su producción. Con el tiempo, desea poner un puesto de ventas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, con el cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le será muy beneficioso y así poco a poco podrá mejorar su vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de sus pagos. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se está vendiendo muy bien en estos meses.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 34, is a simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Hector, 34 and their little daughter, Rosali, who is shown in a happy pose in the photo. From the time she was very young, Mercedes learned to work with the land, since farming has been in her family for many years. She learned how from her parents and now she has her own plantings where she grows potatoes, corn and beans that she sells at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What she likes most about her work is planting the fields since this will produce sales within 6 months. She has been doing this work for 11 years and what she finds the most difficult is the infestation of insects that can hurt her production. With time she would like to put up a stand to sell in the wholesale market in Tarma so that she can improve her earnings. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She feels that the support will be beneficial and that way little by little she can improve her life. In her communal bank she is a very reliable member and she is always careful with the payments. With the one thousand five hundred new sols that she is requesting, she will buy seeds for the beans since this plant is a legume and sells very well in these months.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for beans

loans.name: Alexandre Antonio

texts.es:
Alexandre de 57 años, tiene un taller de enderezadora de vehículos, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Inicio hace años atrás como aprendiz en un taller poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su pequeño taller en su casa para poder mantener a su familia, ahora trabaja desde muy temprano hasta acabar todo su trabajo. El pinta carros los endereza y los entrega listos para funcionar. 

Ahora quiere con el préstamo comprar materia prima como pinturas, metal. En el futuro quiere reconstruir su casa y el taller para darle una mejor vida a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Alexandre, 57, has a body shop. He lives in an urban neighborhood called "Las Orquídeas” which is so named because when it was discovered there were many orchid flowers there. Years ago he started learning his trade gradually in a workshop. As a result of his efforts, he was able to have his own workshop in his house to support his family. Now he works from very early in the morning to finish all of his work. He repairs the auto bodies, paints the cars, and delivers them ready to drive. Now he wants to have a loan to buy raw materials such as paints and metal. In the future, he wants to rebuild his house and workshop to give a better life to his daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy paints and metal

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 33 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rene de 33 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Dania de 12 y Etno de 6 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los cultivos de Nilda, son de los mejores cuidados del poblado de Patay (Provincia de Tarma), en donde la papa, arveja y lechuga, que cultiva son de muy buena calidad, ya que ella se ha encargado de aplicar abono a sus chacras. En el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus productos, los clientes solicitan mucho sus cultivos, motivo por el cual siempre obtiene un buen precio por ellos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de la cosecha, ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo, son recompensados. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo planea comprar un puesto en el mercado mayorista, con el fin de que pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que siente que tiene un compromiso con la institución. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus chacras, también desea comprar semillas de arvejas y papa.
texts.en:
Nilda, 33, is a cheerful and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Rene, 33, and their 2 beloved children: Dania, 12, and Etno, 6, who are the main motivation for all of their efforts. Nilda's crops are some of the best cared-for in the town of Patay (in the Tarma province). She grows potatoes, peas and lettuce that are of very good quality, since she has been responsible about applying organic fertilizer to her fields. In the market of Tarma, where she sells her products, the customers seek out her crops, because she always has a good price for them. What she likes most about her job is the harvest season, since at that time she feels that the months of hard work are rewarded. She has been farming for 10 years. What she considers most difficult is to protect her crops from insect infestations. Over time, she plans to buy a stall in the wholesale market, so that she can increase her income. This is her 8th loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual with her payments, since she feels that she has a commitment to the institution. In her communal bank she is a member who is very dedicated to the development of her group. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy organic fertilizer for her fields. In addition, she wants to buy pea and potato seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer and pea and potato seeds

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y amorosa, vive en una casa alquilada hace 12 años junto a su esposo Martín de 38 y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea darles una mejor calidad de vida. En el poblado de Patay (Provincia del distrito de Tarma), se encuentran los cultivos de Nilda, sus productos son muy buenos y es por eso que la papa, choclo, zanahoria y arvejas que cultiva son muy bien cotizados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende toda su cosecha en forma ambulatoria. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, ya que siente que los meses invertidos en el campo están dando frutos esperados, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar su producción. Con el tiempo, espera ampliar sus tierras y así cultivar más. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y está dispuesta a serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una mujer muy alegre y siempre está bromeando con sus compañeras de grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja para sembrar, asimismo desea comprar sacos de abono para mejorar la productividad de su chacra.
texts.en:
Nilda, who is 36 years old, is a humble, loving mother. For 12 years, she has lived in a rented house with her husband, Martín, who is 38, and their two beloved children, for whom she hopes to offer a better quality of life. Nilda's crops can be found in the village of Patay (in Tarma province). Her products are very good, which is why her potatoes, corn, carrots, and peas are well sought-after at the city's wholesale market, where she sells her crops as a street vendor. What she most likes about her work is harvesting her products, because then she feels as if the months she has invested in the fields are bearing their anticipated fruit. She has been doing this work for 21 years. She considers the hardest part to be protecting her crops from insect plagues that can damage her output. In time, she hopes to expand her fields and therefore to grow more. This is her ninth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has always been very punctual with her repayments and is ready to do so again. In her communal bank, she is a very joyful woman, always joking with her fellow group members. She will use the three thousand nuevos soles she is requesting to buy pea seeds for planting. She also hopes to buy sacks of fertilizer in order to improve the productivity of her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 47 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ceferina de 46 años, quien lo apoya en la chacra y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Pedro, es la siembra de papa, choclo, zanahoria, maíz y arvejas, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma, en donde ya tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 31 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus chacras de la plaga de insectos. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, y para ello necesitará comprarse un auto para que pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono e insumos para cuidar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Pedro, 47, is a cheerful, hard working father. He lives in his own house with his wife, Ceferina, 46, who helps him in the fields. What he most wants is to improve his quality of life. Pedro farms potatoes, corn, carrots and peas which he sells in Tarma’s wholesale market when he harvests them. He has regular customers who knowing the quality of his products don’t hesitate to wait for him to buy everything at wholesale. What he likes best about his work is planting his fields and making them fertile and productive. He has been farming for 31 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be safeguarding the fields from insect infestations. In the future he’d like to continue selling his products but needs to buy a car to transport his crops. This is his 9th loan with MFP. He knows that he has to repay on time if he wants to have access to future loans. He is a responsible member of his communal bank who is concerned for his group’s wellbeing. He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy manure and supplies to care for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and supplies to protect his crops from insect infestations.

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramón Antonio T. T. es casado.Su esposa trabaja por campañas en los fundos.
Cuenta con un negocio de una renovadora (reparación de zapatos)desde hace mas de cinco años.
Requiere del préstamo para invertir en el negocio y así poder adquirir mas materiales de trabajo. Además cuenta con casa propia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón Antonio T. T. is married. His wife works as a laborer on plantations. He has had a shoe repair shop for over five years. He needs the loan to invest in the business and acquire more work materials. He owns his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Justina

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca Justina I. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive por el sector de Visorrey en la ciudad de Cuenca. Esta ciudad se caracteriza por mantener aun su cultura y tradiciones, tiene su centro histórico que fue nombrado el 1 de diciembre  1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

Doña Blanca es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años, ha  llegando a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias. Se dedica a trabajar junto a su esposo en el taller de carpintería que tienen hace 30 años, con este negocio han mejorado su situación económica.

La Señora Blanca tiene 64 años, es casada y tiene  6 hijos mayores de edad que son casados y viven independientemente. Doña Blanca  vive con  su nieto a quien lo crío desde el primer día que nació ya que su madre ha fallecido en el momento del parto, su nieto tiene 14 años y estudia en el colegio. Con el trabajo de ella y  su esposo han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia con el nuevo crédito que recibe lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como madera, clavos, etc para su carpintería.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hace falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Justina I. is a member of the Damas Responsables (Responsible Ladies) communal bank. She lives in Cuenca’s Visorrey neighborhood. This city is well known for its culture and traditions. Its historic city center was designated Cultural Patrimony of Humanity on December 1, 1999. Blanca has been a member of the communal bank for 7 years. She has formed a good bond of friendship with all the members. She works alongside her husband in a carpentry shop that they have had for 30 years. This business has improved their economic situation. Blanca is 64 years old, married and has 6 adult children who are married and live independently. She lives with her grandson whom she has raised from the moment he was born because his mother died in childbirth. Her grandson is 14 years old and goes to school. Her and her husband’s work has made the building of their house possible. She will use the new loan to buy raw materials like: lumber, nails, etc. for her carpentry shop. Her goal is to complete her house because it still needs a few finishing touches.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber, nails, glue, lacquer, etc.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino A. lives in the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old, married and has four grown children. For the last 10 years he has made a living by providing transportation services.  He earns about 3,500 PHP a month from his work.

In 2007, Avelino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid six previous loans from GDMPC and is applying for a new one, for 10,000 PHP,  to buy tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy tires and other accessories

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael M. is from the village of Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 24 years old. Michael is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Michael operates a transportation service. Michael has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Michael joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michael is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the first loan taken out by Michael from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Ndeye Mr Diop

texts.fr:
NDEYE Mr D. D. est une femme de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 03 collégiens. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR KHALY depuis le 23 mars 2002. 

Elle est vendeuse de poissons frais. Elle pratique cette expérience depuis plus d'une dizaine d'années.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin de réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront d'augmenter ses épargnes.

Son objectif est d'aider à mieux prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndeye Mr D. D. is a 54-year old woman. She is married and the mother of ten. She also has three other middle-school children in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Keur Khaly since March 23, 2002. She sells fresh fish. She has been in this business for over a dozen years. Her new loan will allow her to boost her stock in order to reach an income level that will enable her to save some money. Her goal is to help provide for her family in a better way.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing and reselling fresh fish

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame FATOU G. est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR KHALY depuis le 06 décembre 2004 et a 12 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement.

Elle fait la vente de fruits de saisons. Elle en a une bonne expérience pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plus de cinq ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'augmenter ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille. Par ailleurs, elle compte avec ses bénéfices acheter un réfrigérateur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou Guye is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of ten children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Keur Khaly since December 6, 2004, and obtained loans 12 times in the past, without ever having problems repaying them. She sells seasonal fruits. She has a lot of experience after being in this business for over five years. Her new loan will allow her to boost her stock in order to increase her revenues. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family. She also plans to purchase a refrigerator with her earnings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing and reselling seasonal fruits

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr:
Madame MAGUETTE S. est une femme de 60 ans. Elle est veuve et vit avec ses trois enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR KHALY depuis le 23 mars 2002.

Elle fait depuis plus de 10 ans l'activité de petit commerce. Elle vend sa marchandise au grand marché de la ville.

Son crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en grande quantité en huile de palme et en pâte d'arachide pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et réaliser des bénéfices plus consistants.

son objectif est de mieux équiper sa maison en mobiliers (armoire, lit etc.) Elle prend également en charge la dépenses quotidienne de la maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette S. is a sixty year-old woman. She is a widow and lives with her three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank, Keur Khaly since March 23, 2002. She has ten years experience in micro-business activities. She sells merchandise in the large market in the city. This loan will allow her to have large quantities of palm oil and ground nut paste which will make her clients happier and she will create larger profits. Her goal is to better furnish her home (with a bureau, a bed, etc.). She will also be able to better cover the daily costs of the house.

Translated from French by Katherine Evans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil and ground nut paste

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia S. is from the village of Batinay, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Alia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alia runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies, especially banana kabob, in the local community. Alia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,700 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Alia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Alia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for the business

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Marlyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling lake-caught fish in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Marlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
